column4: "his hair and wine stains on his surcoat; Samwell Tarly had gone.  That night; Three-Finger"
"That night; Three-Finger Hobb cooked the boys a special meal to mark the occasion. When Jon"
""Aren't you going to eat those?" Toad asked.  "They're yours." Jon had hardly tasted Hobb"
"a black five-fingered head. Ghost pounced and got it between his teeth. Finger bones crunched. Jon"
"offered small protection.  That grim thought soured Jon's fragile mood. "I need to see Hobb"
"That grim thought soured Jon's fragile mood. "I need to see Hobb about the Old Bear"
"Snow."  When day broke; Jon walked to the kitchens as he did every dawn. Three-Finger"
"as he did every dawn. Three-Finger Hobb said nothing as he gave him the Old Bear"
"and filled a horn. Hobb had given him a lemon; still cold from the Wall. Jon"
